doc.repnme: Proyecto piloto en pequenas localidades del Peru (PPPL)
doc.abstracts: This report deals with a pilot project that runs in 11 small cities in Peru. Its goal is to improve the quality and sustainability of water and sanitation services, through new management models, in which the municipality is represented as the owner and qualified operator of the infrastructure. The processes and outcomes of this project will serve as lessons that may be applicable in other towns or cities that are interested in improving the management of its water and sanitation services. The pilot aims to provide community and municipalities of small cities alternative management of water and sanitation services, through a joint effort with the community, the municipality and a qualified operator.
